Legal_Issue: Is Cipher's fenofibrate product non-infringing under the '475 patent claims?
Procedural_Stage: Section 6 proceedings under Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
Evidence_Assessment: Dissolution profiles, particle sizes, formulation processes analyzed; expert evidence and affidavits reviewed
Credibility_Factor: Expert evidence from both parties assessed
Legal_Rule: A patent claim must be purposively construed
Grounds_for_Claim: Cipher alleged its product lacks essential elements: immediate release, micronized form, inert hydrosoluble carrier
Key_Evidence_Considered: Dissolution profiles, particle size data, formulation methods, expert testimony
Applicant_Challenge: Fournier challenged Cipher's allegation of non-infringement
Court_Result: Fournier failed to disprove non-infringement; Cipher's position upheld
Defendant_Response: Cipher argued its product does not contain essential elements of the '475 patent
Remedy_Requested: Fournier sought dismissal of Cipher's regulatory approval on grounds of infringement
Outcome: No infringement found; Fournier's application dismissed
Remedy_Sought: Prevention of regulatory approval based on alleged patent infringement
Legal_Provision: Section 6 of the Patented Medicines (Notice of Compliance) Regulations
Legal_Provision_Cited: '475 patent claims, Canadian Patent Law, PM(NOC) Regulations
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Allegation of non-infringement based on absence of essential elements
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Regulatory approval for Cipher's generic fenofibrate product
Governing_Rule: Purposive construction of patent claims under Canadian law
